alert.note: Alert for Copiah (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 12 at 4:35PM CDT until March 17 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR SIMPSON AND NORTHEASTERN COPIAH COUNTIES... At 435 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Union, or 8 miles west of Pinola, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. This severe storm will be near... Pinola around 445 PM CDT. Mendenhall around 450 PM CDT. Sanatorium around 455 PM CDT. Magee and Martinville around 500 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include D`Lo and Georgetown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
